Package Custom_CollectionsED.trees.binary.binaryArrayTree

Class ArrayBinaryTree<T>

java.lang.Object
Custom_CollectionsED.trees.binary.binaryArrayTree.ArrayBinaryTree<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the data type to be stored in the collection, must be comparable
All Implemented Interfaces:
BinaryTreeADT<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ArrayBinarySearchTree, ArrayHeap
public abstract class ArrayBinaryTree<T> extends Object implements BinaryTreeADT<T>
This class is an implementation of a Binary Tree data structure, which uses arrays as a support. It is an abstract class, which then serves as a support for inheritance.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    protected int
    count
    Counter to keep track of the size of the tree
    protected T[]
    tree
    Array to hold the structure of the tree

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ArrayBinaryTree()
    Default constructor for the tree, uses the default array capacity to size the array, and starts the count at zero.
    ArrayBinaryTree(T rootElement, int capacity)
    Custom constructor for the tree, which takes in a value to assign to the root element (first spot of the array), and a custom capacity

    • contains

      public boolean contains(T targetElement)
      Makes use of the find method to look for a specific element in the tree.
    • if said element is found, the method returns true
    • if it isn't, the find() method throws an exception, which is then caught in the contains() method, causing it to return false.
      • Specified by:
      contains in interface BinaryTreeADT<T>
      Parameters:
      targetElement - the element being sought in the tree.
      Returns:
      whether the element exists (true) or not (false)

    • find

      public T find(T targetElement)
      Seeks an element in the array, returning its respective reference if found, and throws an exception otherwise.
      Specified by:
      find in interface BinaryTreeADT<T>
      Parameters:
      targetElement - the element being sought in the tree
      Returns:
      the reference to the element being searched for
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - in case the element being sought after does not exist

    • inorder

      protected void inorder(int node, ArrayUnorderedList<T> templist)
      Serves as a support to an inorder iterator, and stores the elements in an ArrayList in inorder
      Parameters:
      node - starting node for the sort
      templist - list where the elements are to be stored
